intro: Polyalthia miliusoides, commonly known as the Malayan evergreen or the hill teak, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
